name: Michael Davis
text: I have done business with this place before, but that will never happen again. I have recently purchased a truck with a CM bed installed on it and the toolboxes are leaking. So, I called CM directly and discussed the issue with them. They were very nice and helpful and also apologized for the inconvenience. They (CM) located a local distributor for me to take my truck bed to for repair. This happened to be Jake's Trailers. The person at CM told me who to talk to and what to tell them to get my issue taken care of. So, I called Jake's trailers today and talked to the owner(or at least that's who he said he was) and explained my situation to him. His first question was, where did you buy it from and I told him a dealership in Tennessee. His response was, "then you should take it back to the place where you bought it". The place I bought the truck(with the bed already installed) was a car dealership, not a CM distributor was my response. You will have to work it out with them, not my problem. I'm asking you to do warranty work, not give me your unsolicited advice. Just lost a customer for life as I will never shop at your facility again. I will also spread the word among all of my friends as well.

name: Remain Nameless
text: Ward.... you were a little hard on the Beaver. The worst place in Oxford is on the south side of Hwy 78 East. The BEST place is A&B and they are located on the north side of 78 just east of Hutch Touch. I'm in retail sales in the trailer industry myself and A & B Trailers is my go to source for information, parts, and trailers. If  I have a question about ANYTHING in regards to dragging a wagon... A&B Trailers.. Knowledge level? I'll put it this way; theres not anything they can't  cover on your trailer.  I promise, they will never lead you wrong. These guys are not pencil pushers that have sit behind a desk all of their lives. They are blue collar, hard working, hands on, highly experienced fabricators and they know their stuff. If you want to spend half of your retirement on junk just to have it fall apart in a few months, then go across the street and shop with Ward. Now if you want an extremely well built, solid piece of equipment at a reasonable price  from an excellent company that stands behind their product AND appreciates their customers?... Welcome home family!! You are in the right place. A&B Trailers. You won't find better people anywhere and let me just add this in there.... these cats are Perfectionists. I know. I have worked side by side with them in a fab shop and I am a perfectionist also, but these jokers....well they take it to a whole nother other level. I will take an oath to say, "They do things at A&B with a whole bunch of heart and a truck load of pride. It's done once, done right, and that's the product they will provide you every single time. I highly recommend A&B Trailers for all of your parts, accessories,  tires, wheels, batteries, or even if you are looking to upgrade with a brand new piece of pride attached to your vehicle.. Come on down to A&B. I'm sure glad I stopped here. Received a solid product and made two friends for life. Where else can you get service like that? A&B Trailers. Ask for Andy or Barney. NO need in referencing my review. They'll know who sent ya when you call them by their names 🤣

name: Helen White
text: I orginally posted a 5 star for this company. But after the delivery of building I purchased, very disappointing experience.  The delivery driver charged an additional $100 for the height and still wasn't at the height for the charge. We had to redo all blocks because it wasn't level or supported correctly. Was basically told not responseable for third party, I didn't purchase it from third party purchased from this business.

name: Don Pulliam
text: Very poor customer service.  I called and asked the owner for a picture of the trailer and he just said that it looks like all of the other similar trailers.  Acted like he was too important to answer my questions. At this point I went ahead and placed a deposit but only because they were the only one that had this model in stock at that time. They would not take my check, rather they wanted to charge me extra for using my debit card.  Supposedly their check checking service declined my check but when I called the service could not find any information about them screening my check or account.  Same with my bank.  I did all of this on speaker with Port City employees listening and they still insisted that I pay extra for using my card and would not accept my check.  Rather, the office manager was will to take my check at this point but the owner refused. Read that again, even with my bank stating that no one tried to verify my account and their service saying the same thing.  And my bank verifying funds were available.  After all of this, they sold me the wrong trailer!!!  I returned it and bought it from a competitor up the road, much better customer service.  I really wish I had read reviews prior to calling them. I went off of the recommendation of a co-worker - never again.

name: Tim Carlson
text: Save yourself the frustration.  Customer Service here is a joke.  Owner used foul language with me when I asked for a very reasonable accommodation.

name: papi101606
text:
Worst place to buy a trailer! Bought a stock trailer from them. Told that it would be ready in a couple of weeks......yeah right. Took a lot longer . When I went to pick up my trailer, it was extremely dirty and you could even see runs in the paint on the front. The owner, who is extremely rude, said that there was nothing that he could or would do, except to give me my money back, minus my security deposit.
Don't waste your time, go somewhere else!!

name: Mo B
text: I'm giving them 5 though it wasn't really a flawless experience but overall I'm a happy customer and will probably be back for more trailers. (I say probably cuz I live 4 hrs away.) The 6x12 trailer i bought is solid and well built. It has good parts and warranty and also had boards added to the top already, an Interstate battery which is protected in a steel box along with the hydraulic pump and battery charger that charges off of the truck battery and also includes a plug for a cord for charging when stationary. Someone forgot to hook up the trailer brakes but they took care of that in short order. I also noticed some of the paint was missing from the under frame and the hydraulic fluid was low. But that's all ok by me because even with that, their trailer is still better built than most others on the market. The ladies in the office were AWESOME, friendly, and take their time with you. I can see where some of the bad ratings would come from some of the shop personels choice of language and not so friendly attitudes but hey, everyone is so easily offended these days. Get over yourself and love others where they're at! Give a grumpy guy a hug! It will put a smile on someone's face! 😁 In the end those guys build a great trailer in a hot shop so cut em some slack.

name: Tab Tab
text: Absolutely ridiculous, I’ve called 4 times within the past two days (along with my husband calling) trying to get pricing for a trailer, and have been hung up on every single time. If it hadn’t have happened EVERY time we called, I’d think it was a mistake. It’s pretty obvious they’re meaning to do it at this point. The women I did get the chance to talk to was extremely rude.

text: This place is the most unusual place I've ever seen. I don't think there is another place that would compare, I just love it. The receptionists are the nicest receptionists that could be. The salesmen are salesmen. The trailers are the top of the line.

name: RuffWater Band
text: I had an enclosed trailer that needed the door replaced so I went to Port City, where I originally bought it.  They said they could fix it and have it back "in a few days".  Well, those few days turned into 6 weeks and spanned the time from Thanksgiving thru New Year's.  The first time I checked on the progress I was told they had not had time to go pick up the door from the supplier.  After that, each time I was told the door hadn't come in yet.  I don't know which was true.  Anyway, 6 weeks later the trailer was ready and I picked it up.  The work was well done and I'm satisfied with the final product.  But the staff (THE ENTIRE STAFF) that I talked to each time was unfriendly and acted as though it was a bother to them to deal with me. After the trailer was there 2 weeks I went online and found the exact same door that I needed, contacted the vendor, and could have had it shipped to me within 3 days and put it on myself.  But I didn't. I let Port City finish the job.  However, I will NEVER take my trailer backback for work OR do business with them again.  They act like they're the only game in town  but they're  not.

resp.text: Sorry, that your trailer took so long to be fixed. We typically wait for a large order  of doors to keep costs lower but could have ordered that door quicker at a much higher price which of course would have been passed on to the customer.

name: Shauny Mac
text: Absolutely terrible!  Walked in and was not greeted by anyone,  even though the "employees" were sitting right there.  Was given one price and when a craigslist ad was brought up,  was very awfully told that they don't mention those prices to customers because they love eating steak and shrimp too.  Was given some ridiculous statement about selling 10 million a year.   The guy must have meant Chinese yen.   I'll happily fill my tank up and drive out of state than deal with these self righteous RIP off artists.

resp.text: Firstly, if employees are sitting around the store is closed. Store does close at 4:00 during the week and 12:00 on Saturdays. On Craigs List ads, especially the utility trailers, prices are as low as they are going to get. Also, when reading the Craigs List ad, it does state "don't forget to mention Craigs List ad" for a reason and that is so you can get those prices.

name: Amy Whetstone
text: I had my fifth wheel hitch installed here and it was a complete disaster.  I realized when I got home that the heads of the bolts weren't seated correctly.  I called back and was told that they just needed to be tightened.  Tightening the bolts is probably the most important part of this whole installation considering I will be pulling 14000 LBS.  I then realize that my back up sensors are no longer working.  I take my truck back and right out of the gate, they smear grease all down the side of it.  I was told by the guy working on it when I took it back that he was working on it the first go around and got pulled off.  Well the side he worked on didn't have any shims under the rails, so what happened there.  The back up sensors were no longer working because the same employee had cut all of the wires when he installed the plug in my bed.  They assure me everything is finished and good and as I pull off, my spare tire is clanging around under my truck because they failed to tighten it back up after lowering it to do their rework.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone for anything.  VERY dissatisfied customer who paid $500 for this service missed 10 hours of work not to mention the diesel wasted going back and forth from over an hour away.

name: Bill R
text: The lady on the phone was nice, but wasn't allowed to give trailer prices. Was given the number to the salesman (who was the owner). I ask for a price and he said "how the hell did you get this number" ,what do you want"  The background was so loud I barely understood him. He was a rude jerk! Frankly I don't know how they have lasted this long on business. He just lost a good sale. I'll go elsewhere.

resp.text: Thanks for giving us a call back, looking forward to your trailer purchase in two weeks. Sometimes, the background noise in the fabrication shop can be quite loud so being patient and calm is helpful.

text: What a disorganized place.  Was passing through and needed a specific bolt.  I was referred to Port City by a local. Walked around for 10 mins before I saw someone who worked there.  They called a parts person. I showed them what I needed and right away they said nope.  I find it hard to believe they wouldnt have this part in this giant pile of stuff.  Lots of other trailer places in a shirt distance.  Stay clear of this one unless you need your car washed and detailed or you need a new patio set.

text: I wish I had read the reviews before stopping by to get an estimate on replacing some axles for a utility trailer. I had gone to Port City Trailer a while back to get some estimates on work and didn't have a good experience then. When I tried them today the attitude was just as bad. When I asked an employee about getting an estimate for the axles, he treated me as though I was trespassing on his property. His words to me were "If one of my tractors hits your truck, I'm not paying for it." Huh?? This is how you greet customers?? Its a mystery to me that you can treat people this way and still remain in business. Needless to say, I left and will never be back.

text: Terrible. They had our work boat trailer for 3 weeks to replace the bearings. I've been given the run around every time I call. Today they said once the part got in it would be an hour to finish.  Well, I'm on hour 4 now since I was told that and last time I looked back there the rear wheel was still off the trailer. Find anywhere else. This is the absolute worst customer service I have experienced in a long time.  They obviously let this trailer sit for 2 weeks while giving us the run around and now I'm backed up against a deadline paying a crew over time to wait until we can depart the state with our trailer for work. F×$!ING terrible.

When I asked how far they were from the uhaul on 90, I was told that they were way away & I had to keep asking more questions just to try and find out where they were. name: Bryan Baker
text:
Shopping online for a V nose trailer I found Cargo Crush. During the covid trailer shortage due to supply chain problems, Stacey at Cargo Crush was the only vendor to even return an email and phone call. She was very helpful and knowledgeable and had a trailer on order that was exactly what I needed. I had many questions during the wait time for this trailer and she corresponded with me promptly even on the weekends. I found Cargo Crush to be very reliable, honest, selling only top brands of trailers at very competitive prices. The transaction couldn’t have gone smoother despite the industry slowdown. I’m very happy with my purchase. I highly recommend Cargo Crush!

Bryan Baker

name: Jonathan Frank
text: The market for off road trailers is crowded and we spent a long time evaluating the available models. We eventually chose Vintage Trailer Work's XTR Off Road model because it represented in our view the best combination of value and quality. We have owned the XTR for 6 months now and have traveled 6500 miles over some fairly challenging terrain. Overall we are very happy with the trailer's performance and comfort level. Vintage Trailer Works stands behind its products. We were particularly impressed with the responsiveness of the owner Damon who personally attended to some minor warranty issues.

text: After having my trailer for 2 weeks they managed to change one brake assembly. I picked up trailer today after them telling me it could be monday or so before they could finish it. Brought trailer home to install other brake assembly and brakes still not working. After I finally got brakes working correctly on the assmbly I installed, I removed hub that they installed on the same side on the rear tandem. When removing the hub I removed the hub nuts with my hand, they werent even tight. After removing hub and inspecting it noticed that the new seal they had installed was goulded and the spindle was also goulded. Have to replace seal again on the new one they just installed. Have had issues with brakes from the day i purchased trailer. I run hotshot loads and cant afford to be down as long as they had my trailer and still have to go behind them to replace stuff. I have replaced the seals on this trailer twice now and replaced 2 magnets on the brakes with no warranty applied. As for as purchasing trailer I could not ask for better service, but maintenance and offering warranty coverage for parts, there has not been any mention of it other than the brake assemblies.

name: April Gibson
text: To say that this place is honest, experienced and knowledgeable is an understatement!!! On Dec 26th at 5:30pm As we were pulling onto the on-ramp, we looked back to see smoke pouring from the back axle of our Forest River 5th wheel, barely averting an Rv fire. I googled mobile rv repair and this was the first number that popped up. I called and immediately got an answer and was told someone would there in about 30 min. 25 minutes later Carl pulled up in his truck with a parts trailer pulling behind. Our bearing went out. Basically it caught on fire and welded itself to the axel.  There was no way to get it off. He took off the tire and limped it to the next exit where his shop was. Thankfully he had 2 used axles. He let us stay in his lot and hooked us up with electric and water. With 2 little kids in tow, this was a huge blessing. The next morning they got to work and in 6 hours the “new” axles were installed. What we were charged was nothing what I thought it was. I’m confident that a dealer would have charged us 4x what we had to pay. Carl and Wendy, his wife, were AMAZING! If we lived close, he would be my repair guy for our rig. I more than recommend!!!

resp.text: We are glad we could fix you as quickly as we could but we would not of minded you being on the lot for a few days

text: After driving 25 minutes to get there I found a sign in the door saying the lobby was closed. I called and the receptionist transferred me to someone who never answered. After waiting 15 minutes I hung up and called back. This time a man answered and I explained my situation to him. He didn't care that I needed parts. All I was asking was for someone to verify which axle and wheel I needed, but they couldn't be bothered. I'll not be back.

name: Paige Wehunt
text: Busy, busy, busy is what Redneck Trailer Supplies was. Of course, I waited until the last minute to go   But they were friendly, efficient, and very helpful to me.

name: Seth Jarrell
text: We had to have a new axle for our double axle trailer. We took the trailer to the facility and the employee measured the old axle, while still on the trailer, for us. After measuring, he then ordered us an axle according to his measurements. We received the axle not to long afterwards. My father and I spent 4 hours on the weekend taking the old axle off and trying to replace the new one. We have replaced an axle before without any problems. This one just would not fit no matter what we did. Eventually I measured the old axle compared with the new one and the new was 1.5 inches longer. Frustrated, we waited until the next business day to return the axle. Accidents happen with measuring so I wasn’t terribly upset. When we arrived at Redneck trailers, we explained that the old axle was 1.5 inches smaller than the new axle. The same salesman questioned our ability to measure and measured it himself going out to our truck and measuring both axles. He agreed that they were different sizes but would not take the axle back and replace it. In fact, he did not even apologize and could not offer us any solution other than taking a torch to the axle and cutting off the U bolts and replacing them in the correct position and welding them ourselves. The only problem with this is that we had to do all that work ourselves, and the new axle will now sit 0.75 inches outside of the second axle on each side. I am very disappointed in the service of this business.

name: Anthony Elliott
text: Great place for any axle! I had an axle on my boat trailer that had off the wall measurements, and although they did not have one in stock, they had one made for me. Took 2 weeks and 2 days before it was ready for pickup. Price was amazing. I bought the whole axle with leaf springs, and hubs fully assemble, ready to be slapped on the trailer for half the cost of rebuilding the old hubs. I will go back for sure!

Also have full parts dept. and new and used trailer sales.

text: I was driving behind one of the trucks and dirt and debris was flying out and hitting my car so I attempted to pass them and they wouldn’t allow me to pass. Really hope their customer service isn’t as awful as their driving courtesy.

text: Though everyones mind was on Christmas as was as was ours it was just a couple a days away when we had a crew that needed to unload in Theodore and were a long way from home with an aluminum repair to be done and Gulf City was the only contractor this company would allow on site. Thanks to Scott, his welder and everyone in the office we got repaired and got our guys home for the holiday. Thanks for a job extremely well done.

Had a trailer repaired at this so called trl repair shop major work
when the trl. came back to our shop it was twisted and not able to even close the doors
contacted Gulf City was told to bring it back and they would repair it again (this was not an option )1200 miles away!
so send it to a local shop and had it repaired right this time
tried to get gulf city to at least refund the labor! and was told NO! (so basically was told we have your money to bad)
this is one repair facility i would never recommend to have a repair done

resp.text: Hi Gary! We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. Pitts Trailers is proud to produce the most durable custom trailers on the market. We're glad your experience has been great and we hope to help you out again in the future. Take care!

name: Terry Morgan
text: They are very helpful with everything, They always answer the phone whenever you try to call them, The people are very nice and very professional If you need any kind of trailer that would be the place to go to, They have also took care of my trailer when it need repaired and did the work on the spot.

name: Jesse Barrentine
text: Great customer service. Who needs a website, when you are looking to purchase product you need to be able to inspect what you are buying.

resp.text: Jesse, thanks for the awesome review! While we do have plans on getting our website up and running in the future, we agree that it’s always best to take a look for yourself. Let us know if we can help you with any of your trailer needs in the future!

name: Steve O'Neill
text: I don't trust a company that doesn't have a website. It's 2021. Don't make me take time out of my day to drive to your location to see what products, services and prices you have. And no, Facebook isn't good enough.

name: H Stevens
text: Bought a 6x10 trailer 7 months ago. Better quality than what’s sold at the big retailers for less money.  Definitely no trouble with rust or wiring like another reviewer. Before buying a hitch extender we thought we might want to recess the jack “no problem, bring it down”. After a tie down broke and the load hit the gate we had trouble with the gate not aligning properly. Took it to Rocket City and they fixed it on the spot without letting me pay “send us your future business “.  I can’t say enough good stuff about this place.  Highly recommend.

name: robert hamilton
text: Awesome trailer for a great price.  Very helpfull

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Robert!  We are so glad we could help.  Please call on us anytime!

name: Mr. Jim Business
text: best prices on angle trailers around, friendly service, and a line out the door and a lot full of trailers when no one else has 6x12 or 6x14 trailers. I did knock them a bit for the fact that the wiring is kinda cheap, no license plate bracket and they use scotch locks to hold wiring together, this will not last over time, but we will see how the trailers stands up over the next few years.

name: Jeremy Och (Carter)
text: Man these guys got it right the first time what a chain auto parts store messed up 3 times.  Guy counter after I questioned got me what I needed and asked the right questions sight unseen. These folks are reasonable and know there stuff!

text: Timely and easy to do business! And fair prices!!

text: Fixed a mess that I had concerning my one axle trailer on a Saturday for a trip I was talking on Sunday.  Not only did they mount my spare they also fixed other issues they found on the trailer.  Thanks to these guys I was able to get the trailer to NC without any issues.

name: jim bockius
text: JUNK  Paint rusting after 2 weeks. Mfg date 11/20/19 2 weeks later paint falling off MFG wanted to give $250 to get painted. What a joke. DO NOT BUY. You will be sorry. Wiring is cheap.

text: My experience with Rocket city trailers has been nothing but excellent.  When I bought the trailer about a year and a half ago, I saw a television commercial and looked at prices online.  When we got there we found a different trailer at a better price which was great!  That was experience one.  I needed it repaired recently and the customer service was over the top!  And the price was more than reasonable, also, the work that was done was first class.  I would recommend this local business to anyone I come across with trailer needs.

name: Steven Walker
text: Best customer service around and couldn't be happier. Billy went out of his way to make sure i bought a trailer. You will not beat their prices as i have shopped around for awhile. Trailers are very well built. I will be a return customer!!

name: Ronnie Maynor
text: I dropped off an enclosed trailer Friday afternoon which had a  burned up axle bearing.  I needed a new axle.  The trailer was ready Monday afternoon at a reasonable price.  They even greased and adjusted the bearings on the other axle at no charge!  Good people to work with.  I would go back.

name: Tim Yeoman
text: I was very impressed with the customer service I received.  This was the first trailer I have ever purchased so I was a little nervous about how to hook up to the trailer and several other things but everything was explained to me and I left feeling confident.  Great Job!

name: Mike Johnston
text:
I had ordered a trailer from them and told it would be 2-3 weeks.  A month later I hadn't heard anything and I had a hard time getting them to give me a status.  I eventually found out that they the plant they order their trailers from hasn't shipped mine yet and there was no ETA.  I know that's not their fault but it would have been nice for them to status me when I would call.  People seem nice enough but I think I was a small fish and they had more important people to take care of.  That's just the feeling that I got.  I might change my review after the trailer comes in...

UPDATE: After two months from date of order, still no trailer.  When I call for status I get told "Billy is in the yard...I'll call you right back."  That hasn't  happened once.  So...if you need to buy a trailer within at a reasonable time frame, I'd look somewhere else.  That's what I've had to do.

name: Donald palazzolo
text: My wife and I are in the market for a shed And I pass this place everyday on my way to work so we stopped by to check them out. This is a good example of why "you should never judge a book by its cover". I told my wife just by looking at the buildings they have there they probably want a fortune but when we stopped by and actually took the time to go in and talk to the owners we found the EXACT opposite. Absolutely nice ,friendly people. And I doubt if you will find a shed or building anywhere around that's gonna be of such quality for so little money. If you are in the market for a shed, storage building or whatever I highly recommend suddenly structure's on highway 22!!!! These are some of the 2 sweetest, caring, people I ever met in my life!! Real talk we put next to nothing down, left with a $25 Visa gift card in hand 2 days later my sheds at my house!!!!!

resp.text: DJ, thank you so much for your kind words. It was a pleasure working with you to get the right building for your needs!

text: Thank you Julie and Tom for the outstanding customer service! They were able to help me find the perfect first camper and couldn’t be more happy! I would definitely recommend campers and more for any of your camper or trailer needs! Theses guys here are amazing!

name: James Bryant
text: So far so good just picked up new rv.  Nice place to work with.  No pressure sale.   Got financing cheaper than advertised and better than local banks.  I'm satisfied with the deal I got my only suggestion is they include free filling propane tanks as part of the sale.

name: Glenn Timoteo
text: Great selection of campers to choose from. Excellent skilled and knowledgeable staff that make you feel welcomed. Took the time to explain and answer our questions. Super friendly environment! After stopping at many other dealerships, I should have stopped here first! I would highly recommend this dealership!

name: chris burrell
text: Literally 5 stars doesn’t do justice. This place is amazing. Julie in the office is extremely knowledgeable and made the buying process extremely easy and fast. I can’t remember the guys name who did my walk through but he answered every question and did an amazing job explaining everything to me. Now let’s get to the service department. They did an amazing job getting my camper ready, but there was a few things at the end that needed to be addressed, and mr cotton (not sure of his first name) went above and beyond my expectations, and has extremely great customer service. You don’t get that much from a service department, but you do here, he fixed the small issues on my camper by saying “I’m not letting any customer leave here like that.” Shows that he cares about his job and the people. He even spent almost an hour and half with me helping me set up my weight distribution hitch. 10/10 a great people person. Thank you so much guys for making this an amazing experience, we love our new camper. Also (if you’re looking at going and picking up a camper same day it’s not going to happen, they are extremely busy right now and they need time to make sure your camper is perfect so it takes about a week, but is more than worth the weight. You won’t be disappointed. Just be patient with them)

name: brooke perfeito
text: Amazing people. Drove here from Florida to purchase our 5th wheel. Glad we did.  They took great care of us and walked us through alot of stuff .  I highly recommend the trip if you're looking for a camper.  Check them out online.  Amazing prices!!!

text: Just purchased a new fifth wheel from Campers and More. Searched for a specific floor plan and options package.  Dealt with Heather mostly through email.  It was by far the easiest process with purchasing a vehicle that I have ever had.  All questions and concerns were answered.  There wasn't any hard sell attempts just honest communication. If I am ever in the need for another RV I would not hesitate to work with her again.

name: Brenda Duterte
text: I call Thursday afternoon to purchase a trailer. Julie said they only had 1 left of the one I wanted. Knowing I wasn’t coming until Saturday, she said she would call if it sold. My husband and I drove 10 hrs to pick it up. Read that again. We drove 10 hrs to pick it up. She was off Fri and Sat, but the older man in front office said “I had phone numbers to call people but someone came in with a wad of cash yesterday and bought it”. Oh ok, that’s a good reason not to give a courtesy phone call. Julie never mentioned a deposit. We just assumed we would get a phone call otherwise. I’m a business owner and specifically needed a trailer within the hour to pick up 2 Ditch Witches that were just purchased as well. Luckily, we were able to go 10 mins down the road to Trailer Sales Alabama across from Tractor Supply and Rick hooked us up and actually came from home to meet us at his shop. I appreciate Michael’s professional response regarding this review, from one business owner to another.

resp.text:
Brenda, sorry for your bad experience. It is my goal to make ALL our customers happy. We do not hold utility trailers with out a deposit. If we held inventory for everyone we talked to on the phone each day we would not have anything available for customers that came on the lot. Again wish for both of us it would have turned out differently and genuinely sorry for the misunderstanding. We would be more than happy to sale you the next size up for the same price if you would like. If you would like to further discuss please give me a call.
Thanks!
Michael Andress 251-645-3966
Owner

I left a very honest review here and the owner, Michael Andress, replied with lies that implied I was lying in my review. He left his cell number for me to call him and I did. He removed his response and then called me back yelling at me telling me he didn't post anything calling me a liar. I have screen shots, Mr. Andress. I started recording EVERYTHING after the second week of being ignored by your company.

Dale did a wonderful job on the repairs that our brand new camper required but he did NOT do them within 24 hours of our first voicemail. He did however drive all the way to us (we were going to drive to you guys weeks ago) and provide excellent service within 24 hours of me leaving my first review.

Seems you could a lot further ahead if you would invest your time into your company's customer service ethics rather than trying to bully all of those leaving honest reviews to change them.

text: I purchased my camper knowing it was not new.  There were some issues I found which due to the nature I had to repair myself due to would do more damage if I tried to return to dealer. That issue was the 5th wheel hitch had a gooseneck adapter which was welded in place causing interference with my 5th wheel receiver. When I discussed with the service manager he was apologetic about the issue and send a Teflon plate to help correct the issue.  Other issues arose during inspection at the dealer and they either made repairs or arranged to have parts sent to my home.  If I carried it back he advised he would repair, but due to distance I decided to make the repairs myself.  I share in the oversite of not doing a better inspection on the lot, but feel they also share some responsibility which so far they have agreed and responded with parts and information.  Working with the service manager we got through the issues.  Always is the question as to where I would do business with them again, and my answer is I would.  Just a bit more observant doing lot inspection.

Thank you for your buisness!

Michael Andress

text: The sales staff was very friendly and their prices are very competitive but we were told that if we had any problems we could call them and it would be taken care of. Now come to find out the unit has a recalled toilet model that is filling with rancid urine from a defective seal and the unit has had more unbearable odors for a week. It has now been over a month and we have left five messages, made contact with Tom twice, the service manager twice, and Julie once. When we do get to actually speak to somebody we are told we will be called back and that doesn't happen. I'm quite angry to the tune of $26,000+ and Tom had the audacity to be irritated with our calling again today.

text: I had to give a star to complete this review they don't deserve it. What should have been a dream come true was a nightmare for me. name: TD Howard Family
text: I seeked out this company because I was in need of an enclosed cargo trailer. I met with one of their associates to discuss their availability and the program for which they operated under. I filled out the application and was made aware of the 4 months of deposit to put down first. I even explained to them my income was low for the previous months. The employee made me aware that it may not get approved because of that and I understood. All I asked was that they look at the reason I needed the trailer so I could make a better income for my family. After waiting more than a week for approval she called and said her "manager" needed proof that I had a contract for what I was needing the trailer and that would help solidify things. Now today when I spoke with her she says her "manager" now needs an additional $500 security deposit. Well I have to say their not getting my business and I will not be sending them any referals. Talk about taking advantage of someone and continually asking for more.....well your place of business is not the only place around and hopefully others will stay away so you will go away.

resp.text:
Howard sorry we could not help you we did our best to get you approved for our RTO program. We have to always consider the risk involved and that is why the security deposit was more. I hope you find someone that can better serve you with a RTO on a cargo trailer. We really did do our best! Sorry it did not work out and I hope your new buisness is doing GREAT!!
Thanks for the opportunity!

Michael

name: XdiamondbabyX
text:
We’re giving Campera two star rating... My husband and I have been looking at 5th wheels for a while. The salesman that showed us around was extremely hospitable and allowed us to look until we were content, even while it was raining. We chose a camper and changed our minds,( after further thought it wouldn’t fit our needs) so we chose another one that would fit our needs and gave them a call. The staff was more than accommodating and worked everything out more than willingly for us. When looking at the different 5th wheel we had some questions and concerns, this is when things took a turn for the worst. The communication between the staff and owner leaves a lot to be desired, to the point that we were ready to walk away. After having a discussion with Mike (the owner) things were cleared up to our satisfaction and we decided to proceed with our cash purchase. It’s been roughly a week since our purchase and we’re currently hooked up at and RV resort. The black water tank was not clean, it was absolutely disgusting complete with maggots! We’re still having an extremely difficult time getting it to drain much less empty. One of the gray tanks was completely full, the other was half full. The built in vacuum system is full, the “starter bucket” had nothing that we could use. Our RV can accommodate a full size washer and dryer but we were told, “we don’t have those.” We went through with the washer/dryer combo install, being told that “it’ll work just as wet.” It’s just a pain and is far from working “just as well.” We bought this particular 5th wheel because of it’s construction and attic package. Buying from them was just a means to an end, I’m sad to say that we won’t be repeat customers and are disappointed with Campers and More to say the least...
I GAVE MUCH PRAISE IN THIS REVIEW FOR THE MANY THINGS THAT WERE HANDLED CORRECTLY, AS WELL AS POINTING OUT WHAT WE WERE/ARE DISSAPOINTED IN. OBVIOUSLY, MIKE (the owner) WOULD MUCH RATHER USE THIS PLATFORM TO CORRECT THE CUSTOMER (of which in our case there’s absolutely nothing to correct) THAN TO USE REVIEWS TO BETTER HIS BUSINESS. WE’VE BEEN NOTHING BUT HONEST IN OUR REVIEW. MIKES REPONSE TO THIS REVIEW ONLY FURTHER SHOW WHY WE WON’T BE DOING BUSINESS WITH HIS COMPANY IN THE FUTURE. IF A MAGGOT FILLED TOWEL AT THE OPENING TO OUR BLACK TANK, THAT WAS FULL BY THE WAY, IS CLEAN THEN APPARENTLY I’M COMPLETELY CONFUSED. AND I CAN GUARANTEE YOU THAT NOTHING WAS FREE. BUYER BEWARE OF A BUSINESS OWNER WHO CONDUCTS THEMSELVES ON SUCH A LEVEL.

resp.text:
Sorry to hear you are having issues I tried calling you back last night at 7pm and left you a msg. You and your salesperson agreed on a price for the used 2011 Montana then days later the day before you were supposed to come pick it up you decided you wanted a TV included in the deal along with full propane tanks a starter kit and a battery so to keep the deal from falling through I gave you these items for FREE. ( This was the only miscommunication between us and you because we had already agreed on a deal and you had even put deposit down.) I'm really confused why you would be complaining about the starter kit you got for free. As far as the washer and dryer combo we never told you a side by side would not fit we told you it was $900 more and you did not want to pay that much for one. As far as tanks not being clean/ full we explained to your husband the day you guys picked the camper up that you could not rely on the tank display gauges inside the camper. We took the camper to our dumpsite/ septic and showed him they were empty and even ran water and cleaner through all of them to satisfy you guys. Not sure what else we can do to make you happy but if you want to give me a call I will do my best. Thank you for the opportunity.

Michael

name: Calvin Hanna

text: Be careful about the used rv's here. They don't inspect them well and only repair superficial items. Water damage was apparent on close inspection on the unit we considered and we dodged a bullet.

resp.text:
Brian what unit are you talking about? We do sell used units and some do have issues but we NEVER hide or cover up issues. We price used units based on the condition of the unit. Sounds like new would be a better fit for you give me a call and we can discuss some different options.
Thank you!!
Michael
